title: Update App from Previous Version *[requires ticket]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user installed a previous version of the Ballpark app 
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has selected a favorite team 
AND user has at least one ticketed event on their account
AND user has navigated to team tab
custom_steps:
WHEN Ballpark app is left in background
AND Ballpark app version is upgraded by installing a new version
custom_expected: THEN User should be on latest version, should be logged in and all data retained.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Loading previous production version from AppStore or Google Play store.
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Previous version installs properly.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Log in with a user, preferably one with various tickets.
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Login successful.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to More > About Ballpark > About Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN previous app version is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User navigates to Profile -> My Teams AND user selects a favorite team

WHEN User navigates to Tickets > Wallet AND views tickets, including barcodes within Scan view

WHEN User navigates to Team Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Everything should load with correct data.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user background the Ballpark app

WHEN Download the production version from Firebase App distro or TestFlight if the production version has been pushed to TestFlight. 
AND User opens the new version of the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN App should replace and load properly form the previous build

AND User remains logged in. 

NOTE - This is the most important thing to verify - the DB/user's login data is preserved and then user doesn't have to login again.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to More > About Ballpark > About Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Upgraded app version is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to Profile -> My Teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User's prior favorite team is preserved

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to Tickets > Wallet
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Users ticket is shown with correct data

title: Onboarding New Signup
custom_preconds: GIVEN User has installed the app, starts app for first time and is presented with Splash Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User taps option to get started 

(if prev logged into the device on prev BP versions, then 'Continue with MLB' button will be shown. If this is the case, tap 'Don't have an account? Sign up' link)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User is presented with Sign Up screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enter valid first and last name, email address, password, and Date of Birth
AND user taps 'Continue'


NOTE: First and Last name can be any character including space and special characters
NOTE: DOB does not have a lower boundary restriction for Year - ex: 01/01/0001 is considered valid
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful
AND Home Tab is presented

title: Onboarding User - Installing BP app via Branch Deeplink *[requires app store]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user does not have BP app installed previously (delete any/all instances from device)
AND user has been given a branch deeplink to access the app
AND user does not have an existing MLB account
custom_steps:
WHEN user accesses the deeplink 
AND user in directed to App store (Android/iOS)
AND user installed the app
AND user creates a new account and completes onboarding
custom_expected:
THEN the deferred deep link resolves and user navigates to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link

** Examples: deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/cubs directs user to Cubs team page, while deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/Wallet directs user to Wallet page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user accesses the deeplink - https://bp.mlb.com/cubs
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is directed to App store prompting install of Ballpark App

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user installs BP* 

IOS NOTE: Testflight can be substituted, if desired version has not been released
Android NOTE: *requires for user to be part of internal testers to allow for install of Release Candidate from Playstore prior to launch. AppTester build can be substituted, if not part of internal tester group OR if desired version has not been released
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN installation of BP app completes successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is presented with Splash Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User taps option to get started

(iOS may show 'Continue with MLB' button if prev logged into the device on prev versions. If this is the case, tap 'Don't have an account? Sign up' link)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Onboarding process begins by presenting user the Sign Up Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid data for all the fields
AND user submits continue
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful 
AND user is logged in successful
AND BP app is navigated to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link 

(If https://bp.mlb.com/cubs was accessed initially, then user should be shown the Cubs team page)

title: Reset Password
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app
AND user is NOT logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has navigated to Log In page
AND user enter Email Address
AND user select Log In with Password
AND user has tapped "Forgot Password?" to show the Reset Password view
custom_steps: [THIS CASE REQUIRES A PASSWORD CHANGE TO OCCUR - IT IS BEST TO ONBOARD A NEW ACCT WITH A VALID EMAIL ADDRESS, TO PREVENT CHANGING PW ON SHARED TEST ACCOUNTS]

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps into 'Email' 
AND user enters a valid email
AND user taps "Submit"

[NOTE: Rule exists 'Your password cannot be any of your last 2 passwords' - so have caution on acct used, if acct is shared]
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the text "Reset password instructions have been sent to your email."
AND an email is sent to the email entered

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user back navigates from Reset Password view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to Log In page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user successfully updates the password (via email)
AND logs in with the new credentials
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is successfully logged into Ballpark App

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app

*Android - v14.3.0 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.4.0

THEN the bottom navbar is shown with Home icon highlighted (filled-in)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates away from Home tab to any other Navbar option

THEN the bottom navbar is shown with destination icon highlighted (filled-in, team navbar icon shown in color)
AND the other navbar icons are shown as deselected (gray)

title: NextTicketedEvent (NTEv1) - Verified Primary Account for Game Event *[requires Tickets] [Android ONLY]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.2.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the Primary email for the account is verified
AND a game event is returned from box office ticketing service upcoming API


NOTES: 
*TDC and TM events should be tested 
*IOS EventHub uses NTEv2 Home card and is covered within another test case
custom_steps:
WHEN the primary email for the account is verified
AND user on the home tab
custom_expected:
THEN user will see event information 
AND be able to access tickets for forwarding or scanning

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a game event is returned for future date
AND user navigates to Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be shown Next Ticketed Event Card
AND user is able to access tickets for forwarding or scanning

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user examines the Next Ticketed Event Card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN startTime/startTIimeLocalText is displayed as day of the week, date, and local time of event is shown within the Next Ticketed Event(NTE) card

Example: 'Tue, Apr 20 - 7:00 PM ET'

AND title is shown of the game event within the NTE card

Example: 'Nationals @ Orioles'

AND venueName is displayed within the NTE card

Example: 'Oriole Park'

AND description is displayed within the NTE card (if description provided in service call)

Example: '<Game Description>'

AND the background color of the NTE card is the primary color of the Home Team 

Example: Orange color for Orioles

AND the background image of the NTE card is shown matching what is passed in the service call 

Example: field/stadium image of the home team

AND the home team logo is shown within the NTE card (if logoPngURL/logoSvgURL for specific OS provided in service call)

Example: 'Orioles team logo'

AND 'Open Tickets' button is shown attached to NTE card
AND the color of 'Open Tickets' text is the primary color of the Home Team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Open Tickets' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the scanview of the tickets 

Example deeplink: ballpark://scanview?eventID=12345&teamID=109 (where the eventID and teamID match the appropriate event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user analyzes the tickets shown in the scanview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user can access tickets 
AND user has capability to scan the tickets (barcode shown, if available)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to Home page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps the NTE card (above 'Open Tickets' button)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the listview of the tickets 

Example deeplink: ballpark://listview?eventID=12345&teamID=109 (where the eventID and teamID match the appropriate event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps back nav on listview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the Home page

title: Next Ticketed Event - GameEvents
custom_preconds:
[BPA-7803](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-7803)
[Figma](https://www.figma.com/design/0oNryxBGauTBWja78zdQkX/Ballpark-Redesign-(DS)?node-id=21233-113018&m=dev)

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has tickets on the account for an upcoming GAME event

**Android - v14.3.0 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended TBD for default enablement on v14.x.x.
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in
custom_expected:
THEN the user is shown the Home Tab
AND user is shown the ticketed event layered on top of the Header
AND user is directed to listview when tapping the NTE Card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Home tab w/ Ticketed GAME Event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown MLB logo and 'Ballpark' logo centered at the top
AND user is shown an envelope icon at the top left, representing inbox
AND user is shown a speech bubble icon at the top right, representing chatbot
AND user is shown an image in the background (top) - green field w/ pitching mound
AND user's Ticketed Event Card is layered on top of the header image, but below the inbox/chatbot/ballpark_logo.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Next Ticketed Event (GAME)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown the event metadata - Team Names, Date, Start Time, Ballpark

* Matchup: Teams playing (e.g., "Nationals at Royals")
** Start Time: Date and time of the event (e.g., "Sun, May 28 • 1:35 PM CT")
** Venue: Name of the stadium (e.g., "Kauffman Stadium")

AND user taps card (above 'Access Tickets')
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the listview of the tickets

WHEN user views the Next Ticketed Event w/ ALL tickets forwarded
AND user taps 'Access Tickets'

AND user taps card (above 'Access Tickets')

title: Next Ticketed Event - Unverified(Game,NonGame)
custom_preconds:
[BPA-7805](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-7805)
[Layout in Figma](https://www.figma.com/design/0oNryxBGauTBWja78zdQkX/Ballpark-Redesign-(DS)?node-id=22995-167422&m=dev)

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app with an unverified MLB acct
AND user has tickets on the account for an upcoming event (Game or Nongame)

**Android - v14.3.0 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended TBD for default enablement on v14.x.x.
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in
custom_expected:
THEN the user is shown the Home Tab
AND user is shown the ticketed event layered on top of the Header (Peeking card)
AND user is displayed “Verify Account to Access Tickets”
AND user is unable to access the barcode, event hub(future for Android), or ticket list view
AND user is directed to Verify Account when tapping the NTE Card

title: Upcoming Games - Location Enablement (w/ and w/out fave team, in/out of range of venue) [TO BE MODIFIED IF NEEDED)
custom_preconds:
Test Cases particular to Home (rewrite).
JIRA [BPA-7882](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-7882)


GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND reg season venue has upcoming data (best if all teams -- otherwise may not match the expectation, when in range(60mi) of a venue that does not yet have data)

*Android - v14.3.0 Existing Home and New Home Tab TBD
custom_steps:
WHEN user is displayed a CTA to ‘enable location’
AND upon tap gesture, are displayed the Android system location prompt
AND upon selection of ‘Allow while using app’ or 'Only this time” are displayed
custom_expected: THEN the Upcoming Section is shown based upon conditions of the particular user (often closest geolocated team next home game, or fave team)

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase1: No Team, within 60 miles of supported venue w/data

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user does NOT have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue(s) within 60 miles (after user allows loc)

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase2: No Team, NOT within 60 miles of supported venue w/data

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user does NOT have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is NOT within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown NO CARD within Upcoming Section (nor "Don't miss out on the action")

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase3: Fave Team, within 60 miles of supported venue w/data

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user DOES have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue(s) within 60 miles

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase4: Fave Team, Not within 60 miles of supported venue w/data

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user DOES have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is NOT within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue of the Fave Team associated w/ MLB acct

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase5(transition): Fave Team, (initially) Not within 60 miles of supported venue w/data, (transition) within 60 miles

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user DOES have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is NOT within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue of the Fave Team associated w/ MLB acct

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters the 60 mile criteria of an active venue
THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue(s) within 60 miles
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue(s) within 60 miles

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase6: Fave Team, within 60 miles of fave team venue w/data

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user DOES have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is within 60 miles of favorited/active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the fave teams venue(s) within 60 miles - indicated with the distance to the venue.
(to confirm that LOC display of Upcoming Games should be shown instead of FAVEteam display of Upcoming Games)

custom_preconds:

Note to complete a check-in User must:

title: In-App message trigger - Wallet Ticket List *[requires OneSignal access & tickets]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater & NOT the Production build)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has tickets associated with their account
AND a OneSignal message has been configured with the trigger key 'ViewShown' set to 'Wallet Ticket List'
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on an event in the Wallet view to open the ticket list
custom_expected:
THEN the app should display the OneSignal message that had previously been configured

NOTE: I have noticed that you may have to set a "Session Duration" to the in-app notification before it will work
*It has been noticed that the in-app triggers may need an app restart AND can take up to 5 mins to be shown

NOTE: If using [Test User](https://app.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/players?test_users=true) segment, ensure specific device is added/updated (may need to be re-added, if not detecting BP app behavior)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN an engineer sends a [OneSignal In-App Message](https://app.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/in_app_messages) 

NOTE: You can use prev created Messages(i.e Wallet Ticket List Test - SteveO), updating as needed and setting as Active. But if wanting to [create new](https://app.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/in_app_messages/new), follow steps below

Steps:
1. Navigates to 'In-App Messages' via OneSignal link above ('Messages' top-level tab, AND 'In-App' sub-level tab)

2. Tap 'New In-App'

3. AUDIENCE: Select 'Show to Particular Segments' and select appropriate segment

4. MESSAGE: Select Message Type, fill out Header text/display, Button action, etc 

5. TRIGGER: Select 'when certain conditions are satisfied during the session'
 
        Select 'in-app trigger' condition and apply 'ViewShown' as Key; 'Wallet Ticket List' as value.
        Tap 'Add trigger' button
        Select 'Session Duration' condition and apply '5' as value.

6. SCHEDULE: Select desired rules to start/stop showing (and additional settings)

7. Tap 'Make Message Live' button

8. Confirm Before Sending and then Make Message Live
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN in-app message dashboard is shown
AND the InApp Message created should be Active

AND user has tickets associated with their account
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Home Page is shown with a Next Ticketed Event card

custom_steps:
WHEN the user receives an In-App message which has a deep link

ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours


NOTE: Seems to take about 15 minutes or more before the message appears
NOTE: To setup deeplink in In-App message, use add "Click Action" on button and add URL there
NOTE: On iOS make sure you do not have multiple versions of the app installed (Double check these links)
custom_expected: THEN the application should navigate the user to the proper location

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN an engineer sends a [OneSignal In-App Message](https://app.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/in_app_messages) 

NOTE: You can use prev created Messages(i.e Team Tab Deeplink Test - SteveO), updating as needed and setting as Active. But if wanting to [create new](https://app.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/in_app_messages/new), follow steps below

Steps:
1. Navigates to 'In-App Messages' via OneSignal link above ('Messages' top-level tab, AND 'In-App' sub-level tab)

2. Tap 'New In-App'

3. AUDIENCE: Select 'Show to Particular Segments' and select appropriate segment

4. MESSAGE: Select Message Type, fill out Header text/display
 
        Add/Update Button text  
        Tap 'Add Click ACtion' button
        Select 'URL' and apply 'ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours'

5. TRIGGER: Select 'when certain conditions are satisfied during the session'
 
        Select 'in-app trigger' condition and apply 'ViewShown' as Key; 'Team' as value.
        Tap 'Add trigger' button
        Select 'Session Duration' condition and apply '5' as value.

6. SCHEDULE: Select desired rules to start/stop showing (and additional settings)

7. Tap 'Make Message Live' button

8. Confirm Before Sending and then Make Message Live

AND the InApp Message created should be Active

Tap here for more information and a list of participating ballparks.


'Delete MLB Go-Ahead ID' display in white within black pills button

*the webpage is configured as 'go_ahead_mlb_ballparks_url' in remote config

Delete MLB GO-Ahead ID

Delete Go-ahead ID - CTA

custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is removed from Go-Ahead entry program
AND the user is returned to Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user successfully Unenrolled from MLB Go-Ahead ID
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should not display with MLB Go-Ahead Entry/ID drawer option on Profile page

title: Okta Access Expires Prior to Pull to Refresh
custom_preconds:
SETUP NOTES:
You will need to have tickets available to the account you will be using.
You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~360 seconds (6 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than 6mins, the refresh may happen automatically.
2) You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

GIVEN a user is logged in
AND User is on Tickets Tab
custom_steps:
WHEN Okta access token expires
AND user performs a pull to refresh (or button tap of 'Refresh')
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be logged out
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

[NOTE: If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user logs in with their MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the user is on the Tickets tab w/ tickets for a future event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND Ticket Tab page displays with Wallet Card

custom_steps_separated.content: [AWAIT EXPIRATION OF ACCESS TOKEN]

WHEN the user access token expires
AND the user navigates to Tickets Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be logged out
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

[NOTE: If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user attempts to log in again (either via Continue, or enter acct creds flow)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in (with a refreshed access token)
AND the user is able to view the tickets on the account

title: Okta Access Expires while User has No Network
custom_preconds:
SETUP NOTES:
You will need to have tickets available to the account you will be using.
You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~360 seconds (6 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than 6mins, the refresh may happen automatically.
2) You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

GIVEN a logged in user with upcoming tickets

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user logs in with their MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the user is on the Home tab w/ tickets for a future event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND Home Tab page displays with all information including Tickets on it

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN network is off (airplane mode)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user remains logged in and can access offline tickets

[Android: you may see a Snackbar when on Ticket list view "Something went wrong, try again" and a dialog message on Ticket scan view "Ticket Details Unavailable" but you will still be able to access the Ticket's scan view]

custom_steps_separated.content: [AWAIT EXPIRATION OF ACCESS TOKEN]

WHEN network is still off (airplane mode)
AND access token has expired
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user remains logged in and can access offline tickets (prior to re-establishing network)

[Android: you may see a Snackbar when on Ticket list view "Something went wrong, try again" and a dialog message on Ticket scan view "Ticket Details Unavailable" but you will still be able to access the Ticket's scan view]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN network is reestablished
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be logged out
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

[NOTE: If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user attempts to log in again (either via Continue, or enter acct creds flow)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in (with a refreshed access token)
AND the user is able to view the tickets on the account

title: Error Messaging: Login Error vs Network Error
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user tries to login to Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user types in bad credentials to login
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app should display the error:

[iOS] "Unable to log in - email and password do not match."
[Android] "Login Failed - Invalid Email and password"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is in Airplane mode AND types in credentials to login
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app should display 

[iOS] "Sorry, check your network and try again"
[Android] "Login Failed - Please check your network connection and try again"
